thread.title: Copper Extends Rebound, Still Posts Quarterly Drop

author: Amrith Ramkumar
title: Copper Extends Rebound, Still Posts Quarterly Drop
text:
Copper prices rose for a third straight session Thursday with trade war worries easing, but the industrial metal posted its first quarterly decline since 2015.
Front-month copper for April delivery climbed 0.8% to $3.0190 a pound on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange. Prices have fallen 7.9% this year, with investors uneasy over weak economic data out of China, the worldâ€™s largest consumer of industrial metals, and trade tensions between the U.S. and China.
